<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/climate-US-emissions-climbed?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Emissions Were the Cinderella Story of 2021
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/climate-US-emissions-climbed?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt='A smokestack with an "on" switch ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/438f6d048a002f967a58d56ae945315c8ed4e5c9-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Much like in-person happy hours, greenhouse gases rebounded in a big way last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As Covid restrictions eased in 2021, US greenhouse gas emissions <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/science/science-news/us-greenhouse-emissions-rose-2021-making-unlikely-climate-targets-will-rcna11431?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped 6.2%</a>, according to a report from the Rhodium Group. That represents a sharp U-turn from the <em>I Am Legend </em>days of 2020, when emissions plunged 10% for their largest yearly drop on record.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While analysts were anticipating a bounce back in emissions in 2021, the data provides a stark reminder that the US is falling behind its climate targets.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A coal renaissance</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The lead singer of the fossil fuel band, coal, was a major contributor to the spike in greenhouse gas emissions in 2021. Coal burned for electricity <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2022/01/10/politics/us-fossil-fuel-emissions-coal-increased-2021-climate/index.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spiked 17%</a> for its first annual increase since 2014.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This doesn’t reflect a newfound appreciation for the sedimentary rock, just simple market dynamics. Natural gas prices nearly doubled in 2021, so utilities revved up their coal plants instead to save money.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Coal, which now accounts for only 19% of US electricity generation, is expected to resume its decline in the years ahead.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Despite their rebound, emissions levels are considerably below 2019 levels, Rhodium Group said, partially because of ongoing pandemic disruptions. Still, the US is not on track to hit President Biden’s climate targets, which would require a ~5% reduction in emissions every year through 2030. The president’s Build Back Better Act planned to funnel $555 billion into a variety of climate programs, but it hit a brick wall in Congress due to opposition from Sen. Joe Manchin.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meanwhile, the world was sweating through <a href="https://www.axios.com/earth-7-hottest-years-climate-change-56fdd198-baa3-44ab-87e1-2fc53f83ce00.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">another scorcher</a> in 2021. Last year was the fifth warmest year on record, according to a new report from the EU’s Copernicus Climate Change Service. And the past seven years have been the hottest seven years since tracking began.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/gaming-take-two-buys-zynga?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Crime Is Coming to 'FarmVille'
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/gaming-take-two-buys-zynga?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Farmville 3, by Zynga." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/cc6a45fad1b15de3aedc8fc1dec13027925f538b-2436x1124.jpg?rect=138,21,2240,1065&w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Zynga</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plant crops, feed animals, take your neighbor’s tractor on a high-speed chase on the interstate—the next <em>FarmVille</em> update might get wild. Video game publisher Take-Two Interactive, known for <em>Grand Theft Auto, Red Dead Redemption</em>, and other popular titles, <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2022/01/10/take-two-to-acquire-mobile-gaming-giant-zynga-for-12-7b/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agreed to buy Zynga</a> (<em>FarmVille</em>, <em>Words With Friends</em>) in a $12.7 billion deal on Monday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In Zynga, Take-Two hopes it’s found the LB to its RB: Take-Two is a console and PC powerhouse, while Zynga is a major player in mobile and social gaming.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Take-Two is bullish on mobile, which it says is the fastest growing segment of the video game industry, expanding 8% annually.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If the deal goes through (it’s expected to close later this year), it will also mark the biggest sale in video game history—until Wordle gets acquired, probably.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The merger would create a company projected to generate $7 billion in net bookings, bringing Take-Two closer to its biggest industry rivals, Activision Blizzard and Electronic Arts.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAXES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/tax-season-2022-IRS-delays-ahead?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
The IRS's Sunday Scaries
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/tax-season-2022-IRS-delays-ahead?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A Simpsons GIF in which Homer asks "Hey Marge, what were your gambling losses last year?"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=511 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-10/image-579540faad2e4edc48717824bf96dedf183a01d9-480x366-gif/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='A Simpsons GIF in which Homer asks "Hey Marge, what were your gambling losses last year?"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-10/image-579540faad2e4edc48717824bf96dedf183a01d9-480x366-gif/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>FOX/The Simpsons</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even though tax filing season is just around the corner (opening January 24 with an April 18 deadline), the typically joyful and charismatic IRS has a case of the blues. On Monday, the Treasury Department warned that the agency has had a rough year and taxpayers should <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2022/01/10/treasury-irs-filing-season/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expect delays</a> as returns are processed.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to Treasury officials, budget cuts and pandemic-related staffing shortages have created a towering backlog at the agency, and a “frustrating season” is on the horizon. While the IRS typically enters filing season with about 1 million unaddressed returns, the number stood at around 8.6 million in mid-Nov. 2021.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened?</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The pandemic forced many in-person processing centers to close.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Pre-pandemic budget cuts to the IRS led to a roughly 25% reduction in its staff.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Federal Covid relief, like stimulus payments and the expanded Child Tax Credit, added more work to the IRS’s plate.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Resources are so strained that, in the first half of last year, there was one IRS staffer to handle every 16,000 calls to the agency.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What can you do? </strong>Those seeking a speedier turnaround should file early, file online, and request their refund via direct deposit, the Treasury said.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

The Only Skincare Hack You’ll Need, Like Ever

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You may be merrily chugging along with your skincare routine, applying lotions and feelin’ pretty good about it. But did you know that 90% of traditional skincare products never actually absorb into the skin?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not trying to burst your bubble, swear. But because skin works as a barrier, it’s difficult to get active ingredients, even water, through. That’s why the smarty-pants scientists at MIT invented <a href="https://droplette.io/pages/morning-brew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=morningbrew_p_20220111" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Droplette: a medical device turned skincare phenomenon that actually gets healthy serums into your skin</a>—20x deeper than traditional skincare.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Droplette’s tech uses proven ingredients, turning them into fast, tiny droplets (100x smaller than the width of human hair), to painlessly mist them into your skin. This means ingredients like collagen, often notoriously too large for absorption, can topically absorb into skin successfully.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sound <em>skinsational? </em>Rightfully so. <strong style="color:#000">This NASA-backed, award-winning tech is being called the future of skincare.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://droplette.io/pages/morning-brew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=morningbrew_p_20220111" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Get 20% off yours today</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/10/key-performance-indicators-january-11?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/10/key-performance-indicators-january-11?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="San Francisco" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/91998472a58f6cf940de6c5b12d960cb21cc580b-4539x3024.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Dianebentleyraymond/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Patrick Collison, the CEO of US tech giant Stripe, shared an interesting <a href="https://twitter.com/patrickc/status/1480647701221896195?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">workforce tidbit</a> on Twitter: In Q1 2019, 39% of the company’s hiring was outside of the Bay Area and Seattle. Last quarter it was 74%. Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky chimed in, “Yup, the place to be was Silicon Valley. It feels like now the place to be is the internet (which is everywhere).”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Quite a lot of people witnessed people in their community dying from Covid, that makes them think life can be short, and you’d better live now than postpone it to a later date.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Rolls-Royce CEO Torsten Müller-Otvös attributed his company’s record-breaking sales in 2021 to the <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/4fe2cec5-8a34-4125-9fff-46c01d5fc60e?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">YOLO mentality</a> during the pandemic. Fellow luxury automaker Bentley also posted record sales for the second year running.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>52 places to travel in 2022. <td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/lululemon-shares-fall-q4-update?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Lulu’s Q4 Likely to Sag Like Cheap Leggings
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lululemon can relate to that feeling of opening up the ugliest sweater you’ve ever seen, because it didn’t get what it wanted for Christmas, either. The activewear brand warned that Q4 revenue would be on the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/10/lululemon-says-sees-fourth-quarter-earnings-sales-hurt-due-to-omicron.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lower end</a> of its initial projections.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s all thanks to Omicron.</strong> The fancy pants maker said the most recent Covid wave rattled staffing availability, store hours, and capacity during the crucial holiday shopping season. Lululemon has also had to brace for the shift to consumers wearing pants with zippers and the relatively disappointing performance of its recent acquisition, home gym platform Mirror.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Even with lackluster revenue during the holiday quarter, Lululemon could post a 23% sales increase over last year, which would build on its impressive growth throughout the pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, Lulu’s warning is a sign that its fellow retailers could also be getting crunched by the ’cron. Macy’s, Walmart, Nike, Starbucks, and more have trimmed store hours or temporarily closed locations recently due to Covid disruptions.<em>—MM </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>For more in-depth retail analysis, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=retailbrew&email={email}&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">check out Retail Brew</a>.</em></p>

Pfizer also said its Omicron booster would be ready by March.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA growing number of finance experts are taking the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/10/goldman-predicts-the-fed-while-hike-rates-four-times-this-year-more-than-previously-expected.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eover\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e when it comes to the number of interest rate hikes this year. color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nEmissions Were the Cinderella Story of 2021\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/climate-US-emissions-climbed?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt='A smokestack with an \"on\" switch ' style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/438f6d048a002f967a58d56ae945315c8ed4e5c9-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMuch like in-person happy hours, greenhouse gases rebounded in a big way last year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs Covid restrictions eased in 2021, US greenhouse gas emissions \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/science/science-news/us-greenhouse-emissions-rose-2021-making-unlikely-climate-targets-will-rcna11431?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejumped 6.2%\u003c/a\u003e, according to a report from the Rhodium Group. That represents a sharp U-turn from the \u003cem\u003eI Am Legend \u003c/em\u003edays of 2020, when emissions plunged 10% for their largest yearly drop on record.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile analysts were anticipating a bounce back in emissions in 2021, the data provides a stark reminder that the US is falling behind its climate targets.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA coal renaissance\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe lead singer of the fossil fuel band, coal, was a major contributor to the spike in greenhouse gas emissions in 2021. Coal burned for electricity \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2022/01/10/politics/us-fossil-fuel-emissions-coal-increased-2021-climate/index.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espiked 17%\u003c/a\u003e for its first annual increase since 2014.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis doesn’t reflect a newfound appreciation for the sedimentary rock, just simple market dynamics. Natural gas prices nearly doubled in 2021, so utilities revved up their coal plants instead to save money.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCoal, which now accounts for only 19% of US electricity generation, is expected to resume its decline in the years ahead.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eDespite their rebound, emissions levels are considerably below 2019 levels, Rhodium Group said, partially because of ongoing pandemic disruptions. Still, the US is not on track to hit President Biden’s climate targets, which would require a ~5% reduction in emissions every year through 2030. The president’s Build Back Better Act planned to funnel $555 billion into a variety of climate programs, but it hit a brick wall in Congress due to opposition from Sen. Joe Manchin.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMeanwhile, the world was sweating through \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/earth-7-hottest-years-climate-change-56fdd198-baa3-44ab-87e1-2fc53f83ce00.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanother scorcher\u003c/a\u003e in 2021. Last year was the fifth warmest year on record, according to a new report from the EU’s Copernicus Climate Change Service. And the past seven years have been the hottest seven years since tracking began.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlant crops, feed animals, take your neighbor’s tractor on a high-speed chase on the interstate—the next \u003cem\u003eFarmVille\u003c/em\u003e update might get wild. Video game publisher Take-Two Interactive, known for \u003cem\u003eGrand Theft Auto, Red Dead Redemption\u003c/em\u003e, and other popular titles, \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2022/01/10/take-two-to-acquire-mobile-gaming-giant-zynga-for-12-7b/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eagreed to buy Zynga\u003c/a\u003e (\u003cem\u003eFarmVille\u003c/em\u003e, \u003cem\u003eWords With Friends\u003c/em\u003e) in a $12.7 billion deal on Monday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn Zynga, Take-Two hopes it’s found the LB to its RB: Take-Two is a console and PC powerhouse, while Zynga is a major player in mobile and social gaming.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTake-Two is bullish on mobile, which it says is the fastest growing segment of the video game industry, expanding 8% annually.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf the deal goes through (it’s expected to close later this year), it will also mark the biggest sale in video game history—until Wordle gets acquired, probably.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe merger would create a company projected to generate $7 billion in net bookings, bringing Take-Two closer to its biggest industry rivals, collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEven though tax filing season is just around the corner (opening January 24 with an April 18 deadline), the typically joyful and charismatic IRS has a case of the blues. On Monday, the Treasury Department warned that the agency has had a rough year and taxpayers should \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2022/01/10/treasury-irs-filing-season/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpect delays\u003c/a\u003e as returns are processed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to Treasury officials, budget cuts and pandemic-related staffing shortages have created a towering backlog at the agency, and a “frustrating season” is on the horizon. While the IRS typically enters filing season with about 1 million unaddressed returns, the number stood at around 8.6 million in mid-Nov. 2021.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe pandemic forced many in-person processing centers to close.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePre-pandemic budget cuts to the IRS led to a roughly 25% reduction in its staff.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFederal Covid relief, like stimulus payments and the expanded Child Tax Credit, added more work to the IRS’s plate.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eResources are so strained that, in the first half of last year, there was one IRS staffer to handle every 16,000 calls to the agency.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat can you do? \u003c/strong\u003eThose seeking a speedier turnaround should file early, file online, and request their refund via direct deposit, the Treasury said.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" The activewear brand warned that Q4 revenue would be on the \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/10/lululemon-says-sees-fourth-quarter-earnings-sales-hurt-due-to-omicron.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elower end\u003c/a\u003e of its initial projections.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s all thanks to Omicron.\u003c/strong\u003e The fancy pants maker said the most recent Covid wave rattled staffing availability, store hours, and capacity during the crucial holiday shopping season.
